metadata.Title: CVE-2022-30780 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Lighttpd 1.4.56 through 1.4.58 allows a remote attacker to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption from stuck connections) because connection_read_header_more in connections.c has a typo that disrupts use of multiple read operations on large headers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2022-30780` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lighttpd - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-gssapi - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-pam - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-authn-sasl - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-cml - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-deflate - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-geoip - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-magnet - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-maxminddb - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-mbedtls - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-nss - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-openssl - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-trigger-b4-dl - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2
lighttpd-mod-vhostdb-dbi - 1.4.59-1ubuntu2

No subscription required
